definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: A practitioner surnamed Zheng, from a county of Heilongjiang, still practices Falun Gong secretly.
sentences.chinese: 一名来自黑龙江某县姓郑的练习者仍然在秘密练功。

sentences.english: Being relaxed, calm, natural is the basic requirement and the fundamental rule to practice Qigong.
sentences.chinese: 松静自然是练功的基本要领，也是最基本的法则。

sentences.english: Answer: Only after practising till have certain basis, you can begin to do like this.
sentences.chinese: 这是讲，练功夫有了一定基础以后才开始这么做。

sentences.english: In Zhineng Qigong, meditation is mainly about concentrating on practice.
sentences.chinese: 智能气功讲的入静，主要是指集中精神练功。

sentences.english: It is very hard for the dancers to get up early in the morning and practice their skills.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员每天都要早起压腿练功，很辛苦的。

sentences.english: Practice through horizontal movement of the diaphragm to breath for the completion of abdominal breathing.
sentences.chinese: 练功中通过横隔肌的运动来完成的呼吸为腹式呼吸。

sentences.english: But if I work hard, how many years will it take to become a master?
sentences.chinese: 但是如果我努力练功，多少年能成为大师呢？

sentences.english: "The training is really rough, just like in the movie 'Farewell My Concubine, ' " Mr.
sentences.chinese: 练功真的很不容易，就跟《霸王别姬》里面演得一样。

sentences.english: "play boxing without internal, you will get nothing".
He always ties a black strap during practice time.
sentences.chinese: 练功时他总是要系上那块黑色的板儿带。

sentences.english: Its not bright, ShaoYang call embroider cloud, to accompany his wife acrobatics.
sentences.chinese: 天还未亮，邵扬就叫醒绣云，要老婆陪他练功。

sentences.english: I have stolen many antidotes from Madam's exercise room.
sentences.chinese: 我在夫人的练功房里偷了好多药出来。

sentences.english: Ballet dancers practise their skill every day.
The artists were going through their daily routines.
sentences.chinese: 艺术家们正进行日常的练功活动。

sentences.english: When you can concentrate, that means you have reached the requirements of meditation.
sentences.chinese: 你能集中了，就算达到练功的入静要求了。

sentences.english: Don't worry, I have got the antidote in the exercise room.
sentences.chinese: 放心，我已经在练功房找到解药了。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
to be obsessed with sth/to go overboard/(Buddhism, Taoism) to misguidedly focus on hallucinations that arise during meditation
to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears
